metadata.Title: CVE-2013-0237 on Ubuntu 16.04 FIPS Compliant (xenial) - medium.
metadata.Description:
Cross-site scripting (XSS) vulnerability in Plupload.as in Moxiecode plupload before 1.5.5, as used in WordPress before 3.5.1 and other products, allows remote attackers to inject arbitrary web script or HTML via the id parameter.

Update Instructions:

Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2013-0237` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
by updating your system to the following package versions:

wordpress - 3.5.1+dfsg-2
wordpress-l10n - 3.5.1+dfsg-2
wordpress-theme-twentyfifteen - 3.5.1+dfsg-2
wordpress-theme-twentyfourteen - 3.5.1+dfsg-2
wordpress-theme-twentysixteen - 3.5.1+dfsg-2
No subscription required

criterions.comment: wordpress package in xenial, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '3.5.1+dfsg-2').
